criteria.desc: Define global necessity of {VARIABLE_X} for {VARIABLE_Y} > {THRESHOLD} using correct counterfactual logic
Define global sufficiency of {VARIABLE_X} for {VARIABLE_Y} > {THRESHOLD} using correct counterfactual logic
Mention threshold value {THRESHOLD} when defining necessity and sufficiency
Analyze outcomes of interventions on {VARIABLE_X} under multiple contexts defined by {CONTEXT_1} and {CONTEXT_2}
Describe potential outcomes Y when {VARIABLE_X} is varied
Provide examples indicating conditions where {VARIABLE_X} is or is not necessary/sufficient
Correctly classify {VARIABLE_X} as {IS_NECESSARY} globally necessary and {IS_SUFFICIENT} globally sufficient for {VARIABLE_Y} > {THRESHOLD}

scale: Score each criterion 0 or 1; total is sum of scores (harder questions expected to have lower total scores).
